intro: Hieracium orizabaeum, commonly known as the Orizaba hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy areas, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium orizabaeum is often found in mountainous regions, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
